definitions.definition: be given, presented with, or paid (something).
examples: most businesses will receive a tax cut

definitions.definition: take delivery of (something sent or communicated).
examples: he received fifty inquiries after advertising the job
synonyms: accept More"she received a letter"be told
learn; informalget wind of "Alec received the news on Monday"

definitions.definition: buy or accept goods in the knowledge that they have been stolen.
examples: a man convicted of receiving stolen property
Turkish television began to be received in Tashkent

definitions.definition: form (an idea or impression) as a result of perception or experience.
examples: the impression she received was one of unhurried leisure

definitions.definition: (in tennis and similar games) be the player to whom the server serves (the ball).
(in Christian services) eat or drink (the Eucharistic bread or wine).
consent to formally hear (an oath or confession).
examples: he failed to find a magistrate to receive his oath
the basin that receives your blood

definitions.definition: suffer, experience, or be subject to (specified treatment).
examples: the event received wide press coverage

definitions.definition: respond to (something) in a specified way.
examples: her first poem was not well received
synonyms: react to "he received her suggestion with a complete lack of interest"

definitions.definition: meet with (a specified response or reaction).
examples: the rulings have received widespread acceptance
synonyms: react to "he received her suggestion with a complete lack of interest"

definitions.definition: widely accepted as authoritative or true.

examples: the landward slopes receive the full force of the wind
representatives of the club will be received by the Mayor
synonyms: say hello to "they received their guests"

examples: she was not allowed to receive visitors
hundreds of converts were received into the Church
three lines are reserved for special vehicles, and the remaining lines receive the general rolling stock
